caption: The food was bland, I had to go home and add seasoning. I ordered the New York strip, mashed potatoes and broccoli. The broccoli had nothing on it at all, the steak had pepper but needed salt. The mashed potatoes needed butter but it was flavored at least. The size of the steak for the price 36 dollars exceeded my expectations but the amount of broccoli they give you for 7 dollars is laughable. However this is a more upscale steakhouse so I guess I understand. The good reviews are what led me to order from here and the food is decent. It probably would’ve been better if I ate inside instead of taking out. I had to call in to order because their ordering site was down and it being my first time I asked the hostess how did they cook their steaks looking for if it was made with garlic butter or a different method and the hostess said she didn’t know. Not to bring her down but in customer service “I don’t know” isn’t something you should ever say, even if you don’t know the answer go and ask someone. Other than that I would order from here again but I would dine in to get better service and food.

We ordered Filet mignon, medium well. The steak was burnt, we couldn’t even eat it. The guy took the steak back to the kitchen after we told him it was burnt, he came back and said he tried it and it never tasted burnt to him so he’ll still have to charge us. Mind you, we had only the one bite. Horrible service. The Atmosphere was good but that encounter was just horrible. I’ve been to many other restaurants before and if the food isn’t up to the customers standards, they never charged us or at least try to fix the issue/ changing the food.

The ambience of the restaurant, the decor and the vibe of the restaurant is great. If you are having a birthday, anniversary dinner or and thing that you need an intimate setting then this is the place to go. They also have a live saxophone player there playing which was nice. The food is beyond delicious and better than I expected. The variety of the menu is 10x better than going to peter lugers steakhouse. The salad with goat cheese was the die for. The fried calamari was excellent and it tasted extremely fresh. The herb butter and complementary bread was also tasty. The steak was extremely delicious and thick. I would definitely come here again. If you want to try a steakhouse with delicious food then this is the place to go. The only thing that can be a downside for people is that their is a built in 18% gratuity charge. If you are okay with that then you would love everything about this restaurant.

I usually don't care to write large reviews but the atmosphere was great. Staff is exceptional. The food was fabulous. A must dining experience if you've never been. You never had to wait for drinks to run low and the servers made sure to explain everything perfectly. I will definitely be back

The food... delicious. The cheapest dinner is probably $25 but absolutely worth the price and ambiance. Customer service is off the charts.

We had a reservation here last night and the waiter who took our order was fantastic. However, we noticed that the person that brought our food out nor the kitchen staff weren’t wearing masks. In addition to that, the bathroom was out of soap so it makes me wonder how the kitchen staff were able to cleanly wash their hands. I wouldn’t come back to this restaurant unless these concerns were addressed. Food-wise, the t bone and rib eye was okay (a little over coated with butter).

This place provides amazing service and delicious menu. One of the best place in the city. The drinks and food came out rapidly and the rates are affordable. I recommend this place.

I am giving a 3star not because the food was bad but because the waiters were clueless that corona was still around. The placed was over booked, people sitting less than 6 ft apart, waiters not wearing masks except 1 individual and they were interacting with customers some of whom were elderly. When asked why they were not wearing a mask, one waiter said it was uncomfortable, and that it didn't matter since it was a full house anyways and also recommends customers stay home instead of coming out to eat if they had problem with how things were done in the restaurant. These are the reason why our #numbers are going up. I have been to other restaurants and they respect the current public health policy in place but not this establishment.

Absolutely beautiful!  Although the seating is outside on the sidewalk it was beautiful! Had an amazing waiter (I forget his name) but he recommended a mango margarita that was delicious!  Food was delicious, service was perfect! Celebrated my 5th wedding anniversary there and he gave us some chocolate cake to celebrate on the house! Photos were appetizers, but we had skirt steak and salmon that was fantastic! First time going but I'll be back!

Went to Atlas steakhouse two weeks ago on a Saturday night and was surprised that there appeared to be no social distancing as we were seated against the wall, behind  one large party and another couple.  We also noticed they to have an 'optional' mask wearing rule though it was inside dining.  Both our waiter as well as the bartender wore on masks, I thought this was no a rule for inside dining?  Anway instead of indoor dining we took our food to go.
The space and service was amazing. The steak was okay. I was surprised that the sushi selection was on point and the highlight of our meal. It was the perfect place to celebrate my husbands birthday.
terrible steak

The food is delicious 😋. Everything we had was delicious and prepared to order. My only negative was I found the salt content somewhat high but I am salt sensitive. This may seem simple but the garlic butter served with the dinner rolls is scrumptious (like melt a portion on my food scrumptious). The crab cake is made from lump crab, with zero breading and it doesn't have the mayo like taste I have found in other crab cakes. I had the Chilean Sea Bass, creamed spinach and mushroomsn he had the Rib Eye, French fries.  The fries were done to order but I found salty. The cook on the rub was near perfect but the flavor profile was near perfect. My dish came with a side of mashed potatoes which I did not like due to personal preferences.  Drinks Pineapple mojito: Excellent, the drink was not too boozy and the pineapple flavor came through with freshness. This drink was not too sweet nor was the sugar left grainy. Side car: I have never had one before, but this drink was also delicious. Not boozy or too sweet.

I was shocked when I walked in. This is a fabulous steak restaurant in Flatbush. Very comparable if not better than a lot of high priced Manhattan restaurants. The prices here as also fantastic for the meal you are getting. We had wine, cocktails, escargot, shrimp and some excellent cuts of steak and it shockingly didn't break the bank. The bar is fantastic, with excellent selection and wonderful service. The live music was perfect, not too loud and so romantic. The ambiance in the restaurant is fabulous as well. I highly recommend them.

I recommended trying out this steakhouse about a year ago to friends of mine, and as thanks for that they brought me here as a birthday treat. I can say without reservation that this was one of the best dining experiences I've had. First off, the decor is really lovely - they took time to integrate Christmas decorations into their usual design. Second, the service is top-notch - not only did they remember my companions and me, but they ensured that my visually impaired friend was safe navigating the restaurant. Our waiter, whose name I'm afraid I don't remember exactly but who delivered great service last time I was here, was very knowledgeable about the food and didn't hesitate to answer questions, and was friendly without being overbearing. My cocktail was very nicely mixed. Appetizers were fabulous - perfectly executed calamari, escargot only surpassed by Balthazar's and other top-line French restaurants, and a gorgeous fried Camembert that was sweet, salty, umami, and had a fantastic oozing texture. The mains were simple and perfectly executed - the branzino got rave reviews, the New York Strip was meaty and flavorful, and my skirt steak was cooked to a perfect juicy medium rare with the perfect amount of char. For dessert, we had a mixed berry cake that is tart and sweet, and a mango mousse that was rich and yet light at the same time, accompanied by some lovely teas.  I wish I'd taken pictures, but I was just kind of caught up in the warm and cozy atmosphere and great food. Prices are a bit high for my personal budget, but every dollar is represented in the budget. I'm really grateful to the staff for making my birthday a night to remember, and when I can, I'll be back.
The chef is professional and very nice stuff!!!
Excellent delicious food and dining.  Great music  and ambiance. Wait staff are attentive and friendly.  I will back again.

Went on a date twice to this Atlas four months apart. Waiter remember us, 🤗 Food was delicious, 😀 Atmosphere is nice,  Background music cool, 😎 Definitely a place to go! Oh, forgot to say t hr at prices are very reasonable.

My wife, brother in law and his wife decided to go here at the last minute. We still talk about our pleasant gourmet experience at this restaurant and will return as soon as possible with children and friends. Why drive to Manhattan when you have excellent food right here in Brooklyn.

We had a fantastic experience, the service was superb. We had the Tomahawk steak, which is for two, which is 48 ounces of beautifully cooked tender heaven. Oh, and their freshly baked rolls with herb butter were divine. We didn't have an appetizer or dessert, because 48 oz steak, but they looked wonderful going past us. We will have to come back and be a bit more restrained with our entrees so that we can expand our scope. We will definitely be coming back.

Hit or miss with this place. Went 2 weeks ago and everything was fantastic. Went this evening and had a totally different experience. I ordered the Prime rib and asked for an end cut , if available . Instead they brought out the steak sliced for A  3 year old . Cut into Little pieces .Waiter claims the kitchen didn't understand my request. Never In my life , Have I heard of A steakhouse not knowing what an end cut is ! Then had to send it back again because it was raw in the center. Mind you there was a 15 min wait during the meal. My wife was done eating and I still had nothing. Manager no where to be seen. They took off 10 % for messing up the steak two times. A whopping $5.80 . To add insult to injury , we ordered dessert to go. Here is a picture of what we received for $15.00.
Great service. Greay food. Fabulous server. All in all a wonderful experience.

Delicious food and amazing service. Paul was helping us out with our food is super nice, polite and has a very sexy British accent. Place is super romantic and indescribable beautiful. Great steaks. We will be back.
Great steaks, lambchpps, grilled shrimp and cocktails.  Staff is *mwah*.
Beautiful restaurant. Food was good, service a little slow. Crab cake and Cyprus salad was really good!
Excellent Food, Excellent Service, Definitely worth the $$$.

comfortable atmosphere and the wait staff were attentive...my wife and I are not steak lovers and that is really the reason to dine here.....we were guests of steak loving friends who have dined here previously
Attentive service. Food was very good. Going to revisit to get better feel.
Food was great service was excellent 🍷
The food was very  very expensive  and the tomahawk  steak was small over cooked and very very fatty. I will not visit there ever again.  I will not  recommend  to anyone.
Beautiful atmosphere and very professional staff.  Romantic
Loved it! Steak was on point and so was service! Had anniversary dinner there and it was a good choice...live saxophonist was awesome.
Loved the service, Steak was great... the side were ok... had a great time for my husband's birthday.

This restaurant is absolutely amazing. My experience at this establishment was wonderful from start to finish . Starting from the outside in , the restaurant is designed to be subtle but sophisticated on the outside. Upon entering the first corridor of  the restaurant you find all of the restrooms . I found this design interesting but convenient because the rest rooms were available to customers as soon as they entered .  Also , the rest rooms are separated from the dinning room so that customers aren’t interrupted by flushing sounds or worse while they are eating .  After walking past the restroom there is another door that leads to the bar area where we were received  by our waiter Paul . Paul was the best waiter I have ever had hands down . He was attentive and accommodating. He constantly checked on my date and I to make sure we were enjoying our dinner . He gets five stars on his own for being amazing at his job.  Now let’s talk about the food. My date and I ordered two Caesar Salads that were super fresh, two surf and turfs which consisted of Fresh lobster tail which was scrumptious , filet mignon, pita bread and a side of salads . We also ordered the crab cake appetizer which was also delicious and a large enough proportion for two people to share. We were also served bread rolls with fresh garlic butter . My date ordered a fountain drink which came to our table in a lovely glass bottle. I ordered white wine moscato which was absolutely delicious as well.  Lastly we ordered a creme brûlée because my date and I were celebrating our anniversary and Paul brought it out to us with a lit candle on top, which I thought was so thoughtful of him to do. As expected the dessert was just as amazing as the food .  All of the food that we ordered was delicious with no flavor overpowering the other . The service that I received along with the amazing food left me and my date happy to pay the bill which was actually quite expensive. All in all I would return to this restaurant again . The food , service and ambiance combined together sets a Romantic mood perfect for couples searching for a great place to dine .
Food was excellent , Paul the waiter was exceptional. They don’t have enough desert of what you want
I heard that It's An Great Place Time to Have Dinner,Social Event,& Etc.
Expensive, but worth every penny.
Have not visit this steakhouse yet but will visit in the future.

Atlas is a beautiful place. The food is amazing,  & the staff is very friendly & welcoming. I was surprised, @ how reasonable the prices were considering the ambience & the display & taste of the food.I would recommend this place.
Nice place

Went for my birthday and i love steak let me tell you they cook it how u want.. charred etc and the prices arent out of this world. Sonce im from the area its going to be my go to local steak place.. its offical i am a FAN.. THEY DIDNT SING HAPPY BIRTHDAY THO.
Great atmosphere; however  have had better steak at other places!
Tantalizingly delicious steaks whether it's salmon, tuna or beef.

Everything about this place is great.  The steak is excellent and perfectly cooked.  The service is 5 star.  The drinks are solid. Plenty of alcohol and taste good.  Been to atlas steak house twice now,  and similar excellent experiences both times.  Maybe it doesn't have the atmosphere of a Gallagher' s for instance,  but if you don't want to go into Manhattan,  this place is great

Amazing food, juicy and mouth-watering steak with a good selection of drinks and even more amazing service by Paul Martin, an unparalleled waiter in terms of practicality and charm. Give the man a raise and serve me up another steak!
Horrible place,AC is off, food undercooked Sea Bass was raw they offered me to re cook it...........and prices are insane $35 for tiny piece of undercooked Sea Bass. Steak had funky taste. Stay away
The food was good but they have a dress code that is sporadically enforced and I could do without worrying about.  It is also kind of loud inside, but service was great so very mixed feelings.
Great food and great service

Consistently great service, great food and great atmosphere. Our 6th time back. Honestly one of the last good steakhouses in Brooklyn! PS the head waiter Edwin is the most genuinely nice and attention to detail  person in the industry. On our most recent visit he made our anniversary so much more special by coordinating everything perfectly. The tomahawk steak is a must! (Get it med-rare)
The staff are so wonderful and personable. This place is great for romantic dates or family nights.  Please remember to dress casually as they try to adhere to a dress code
I love the atmosphere and the crab cakes were delicious.

I went in February, the ambiance was incredibly. I had the crab cake and the T-bone steak with mashed potatoes and spinach, the food was amazing. Seasoned with perfection. The wine selection was great. The staff was very excellent...  The best steak I’ve had.

It was a great experience we celebrate my nephew's 34th birthday the atmosphere was nice however the light fixture or not working where we sat at an a little chilly the young adults sit with their coats on . The music was nice that the lady played.  The waiters were  very courteous well mannered to us ,though. The food was good however the rice from two Adults dinners was cold. I wouldn't come back.
Good services very great adatude the foods are great  and i will redament there to any one of my friends

Excellent! It's rare to find a place that combines lovely ambiance with great food and quality service, PLUS entertainment. Celebrated my birthday with family here. There was a saxophonist playing throughout dinner and they sang Happy Birthday upon presenting dessert. What an experience!
My all-time favorite entree is the branzino. My last visit I decided to change and get the  chicken. It was DELICIOUS!!!!
Lovely surprise! Great service, delicious steaks and even live music!
Loved it... On point
A Very excellent place to enjoy and eat.
(Translated by Google) Very nice very elegant  (Original) Muy bonito muy elegante

We went to Atlas Steakhouse today Saturday at 2pm to celebrate my husband's birthday. The appetizers, food and drinks were great, but especially the service. We ordered from their brunch and dinner menu. Our server Marshall was wonderful and very attentive. He was charming, entertaining and amusing. We spent almost two hours there as it was so relaxing. I highly recommend their New York Strip 12 oz with eggs and their grilled shrimp. My husband enjoyed his rib eye steak. We plan to go back.

I made reservations for my husband's birthday. I called 3 times. When we arrived the reservation wasn't there so we were asked to sit at the bar for 15 minutes. 15 turned into 50 and of course we got drinks which we probably wouldn't get otherwise. The drinks were great. No complaints there. We got mushroom appetizer which was delicious. For the main dish my husband was going to order a ribeye steak. The menu options were a 24oz or cut to order per pound. Which of course they said they don't offer anymore only 24oz. Ok. We order 24oz. The steak was absolutely amazing but nowhere near 24oz. Maybe a pound or just a bit over. For $48.00 no vegetable or side dish comes with it. I had fish which was good and came with everything. The place is very nice. The service is good. The food tasted great. But I feel it is overrated for this location.
The best brunch in Brooklyn
Staff was AMAZING! Food was delicious. Definitely recommend.
The food & atmosphere was great. Parking was a lil tight. I would definitely go again.

The food was delicious and the atmosphere is very calm/ chill. This was on Valentines day and maybe the service isn't like this on normal days, but even with a reservation, we had to wait some time for our seats. Also they did not refill our glasses with water except at the end and when I asked for the dessert menu, got handed the bill. Lastly, don't know if this is allowed, but they put a gratuity charge (for 2 people) on the bill automatically, which we did not like.

Enjoyed a lovely evening with my wife here. Certainly Manhattan prices in a Brooklyn restaurant. A bit overpriced. The restaurant is nice, wish I could come back here later to give them a 5 star rating. The establishment is lacking live entertainment or shows, beyond a solo pianist. Maybe the management should do weekend promotions to help drive up the attendance. Our waiter was good, the host seemed a tad young to be a host in a restaurant such as this. Overall, it was a positive experience.
Food was good..service was great... I drank s lot.. so my I'm judgement might be off... then scrub went ain't it

Came here last minute after a long day out and about. The boyfriend wanted steak and this was the closest to us at the time but it really was surprisingly nice. We made a reservation maybe 30 minutes prior to getting there and fortunately there was no wait for us. We may have gotten lucky with the timing. Service was very on-point. The waiter was very nice, attentive, polite, and didn't annoy us with too much checking in. Boyfriend had the medallion steak that was OMG, divine (for a steak, considering I prefer seafood and tofu over red meat). I chose a filet mignon which was good but was even better with a little more seasoning. Also had the Rosé and boyfriend had the Malbec. This was such a fantastic last-minute find! If I'm ever in the area and craving steak, I'll definitely get the medallion for myself.

Plesently surprised! From the front receptionist to the staff and of course the food. I live around the corner from this place and never noticed such a great steak house was so close to me. I typically go into the city for dinner but now I …

We eat here pretty regularly and enjoy it. Very good steaks, food service and friendly hostess. This time it was quite crowded and we had to wait. (We arrived without reservation.) I will make reservation from now on. Place is on OpenTable which makes it easy.
Atmosphere and ambiance is great. The food is excellent.

I just want to take the time and say Thank you to Edwin and staff for making our first time visit a wonderful experience... The setting was perfect the waiters were awesome. Everyone looked happy to be at work. Very friendly and mellow atmosphere. The food was delicious. The menu is so what limited though. Edwin was wonderful from the time he introduced hisself to us.. Loved it!! My bestfriend enjoyed her birthday and i enjoyed it with her! KEEP IT UP GUYS!!!
Great steaks.  Carnivore heaven!
First time here but loved it and t bone steak was so good my wife and i will be back often thabk you to the amazing service there
Lovely restaurant. Has a romantic ambiance, but great for family dinning as well.  Love the live lite jazz music

The food was excellent! The staff was very friendly, the drinks where Not watered down. The atmosphere was beautiful. Now you don't have to go all the way to Manhattan for a greag steak! I highly recommend.
Nothing but perfect...

Their steaks are huge, juicy, and delicious! And they cook the meat to the perfect temperature I asked for, sadly not all steakhouses do that for some reason. The dry salad the side was a little confusing but I was too focused on the meat to care. My waiter was very friendly and the bartender was awesomely generous with our drinks. Can't wait to go again!

This is an awesome place for steaks if you can.put away at least 24 oz.  I had the smaller skirt steaks and it was cooked exactly the way I wanted it, with a side of creme spinach and mushroom with excellent mash potatoes.  This is a must.place to go for Fine American Dining in this neighood that lacks good restaurants.  There is also great live music to accompany dinner.
The best steak ever! Perfectly prepared, soft and juicy. Nice atmosphere, great service, live music. Thank you.

Steaks are great. Their steaks are cooked properly. Their prices are a little high but food is excellent. I also tried their lobster brioch. It was really good. Rich and creamy. I definitely recommend this place. Will go again soon.
24oz is the smallest option they have on all cuts, other than an 8oz filet. Wish they had 12oz & 16oz options on other cuts.
Good job
The food was good. Pricey though.
